alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 12 at 1:55AM PST until January 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Surf up to 8 feet today, highest in southern San Diego County. Surf 5 to 10 feet Friday through Saturday, with sets to 12 feet in San Diego County. Surf up to 8 feet Sunday. * WHERE...San Diego County and Orange County beaches. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and minor beach erosion. Minor coastal flooding of low lying beach areas and parking lots around high tide Friday afternoon and early Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide of 3.54 ft at 1210 PM Friday and 4.08 ft at 213 AM Saturday.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
